newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks fall two percent in morning trade.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks fall two percent in morning trade.

text.p: Tokyo stocks tumbled two percent in morning trade on Tuesday, the first day of the new business year. Brokers said the market was following close on the heels of the U.S. markets, which posted heavy losses overnight, while selling of blue-chip issues was gaining momentum in Tokyo.
At 0037 GMT, the Nikkei 225 was down 417.64 points or 2.32 percent at 17,585.76. June Nikkei futures were off 300 points at 17,550.
"Nikkei futures in Osaka are hurrying to catch up with the Nikkei futures in Chicago, which ended below the Osaka close on Monday," a broker at a mid-sized brokerage said.
